title: Register your boat with the coastguard's safety scheme

details.description: Register your boat with the UK coastguard using the Maritime and Coastguard Agency's voluntary safety scheme (CG66)
details.more_information:
Your details will be available to Maritime Rescue Co-ordination Centres (MRCCs) throughout the UK. This will give them the information they need to mount a search and rescue operation if you get into difficulty.

You need to update your details every 2 years.
details.introduction: Fill out an online form to register your boat’s details with the UK coastguard. This is a free service for owners and skippers of all types of leisure vessels and small craft.
details.will_continue_on: the Maritime and Coastguard Agency website
details.alternate_methods:
Download the ‘Register your boat’ registration form (PDF, 353KB)

You can also get a form from:

  • an HM Coastguard sector base
  • a MCA Maritime Office
  • a Royal National Lifeboat Institution (RNLI) boathouse
  • your local marina or sailing club
